statement: Dimash learned that Mansur wrote something very unpleasant about him to a friend, so he decided to find out his password at all costs and discover what exactly he wrote.Believing in the strength of his password, Mansur stated that his password — is a binary string of length n. He is also ready to answer Dimash's questions of the following type:Dimash says a binary string t, and Mansur replies whether it is true that t is a substring of his password.Help Dimash find out the password in no more than 2n operations; otherwise, Mansur will understand the trick and stop communicating with him.
input_specification: InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100). The description of the test cases follows.
note:
In the first example, the string
010
is given. Therefore, the answers to the queries are as follows:
"? 00"
00
is not a substring of
010
, so the answer is
0
.
"? 000"
000
is not a substring, so the answer is
0
.
"? 010"
010
is a substring, so the answer is
1
.
In the second example, the string is
1100
, in the third
0110
, and in the fourth
10
.
